item.title: SMARTAS Luxury Bath Tissue
item.description: Smartas is a brand dealing in lively and bold disposable articles. Their prime commodity is toilet tissue, which is sold in various color and odor presentations. Our objective consisted in designing a visual idea that represented Smartas' fun and youthful spirit. The logo depicts a mortarboard and toilet tissue combination, a conceptual wink at the brand's cheeky naming. The proposal is simple, a deliberate decision meant to highlight the paper's bright colors. We used a rounded typeface to give the brand a friendly and sincere personality.
item.content:encoded: Smartas is a brand dealing in lively and bold disposable articles. Their prime commodity is toilet tissue, which is sold in various color and odor presentations. Our objective consisted in designing a visual idea that represented Smartas' fun and youthful spirit. The logo depicts a mortarboard and toilet tissue combination, a conceptual wink at the brand's cheeky naming. The proposal is simple, a deliberate decision meant to highlight the paper's bright colors. We used a rounded typeface to give the brand a friendly and sincere personality.

item.title: Veinticinco obras, 25 años. Jofebar
item.description: Diseño de Publicación para el 25 aniversario de Jofebar, en la que se muestra la trayectoria de la compañía a través de una selección de 25 obras de arquitectos de referencia actual como Rem Koolhas, Carlos Ferrater, Francisco Mangado, Álvaro Siza o Eduardo Souto de Moura, entre otros. El libro está íntegramente compuesto por desplegables y divido en 25 apartados en los que se detalla cada obra a través de fotografías de Juan Rodríguez, detalles técnicos, textos de los arquitectos y una selección de dibujos destacados en Pantone fluorescente que muestra la concepción del arquitecto yuxtapuesta a la construcción final. La encuadernación en tapa dura se completa con una sobrecubierta a modo de faja en el color Pantone fluorescente en el que destaca un troquel que recuerda la trama de malla metálica más reconocida de la compañía Jofebar. Cliente: Labirinto de Paixóns, Jofebar. Proyecto realizado en ©tresctres bajo la marca de Diseño Editorial trespuntos. Dirección de proyecto: Juan Rodríguez. Fotografías de proyecto: Anabel Carrión.
item.content:encoded: Diseño de Publicación para el 25 aniversario de Jofebar, en la que se muestra la trayectoria de la compañía a través de una selección de 25 obras de arquitectos de referencia actual como Rem Koolhas, Carlos Ferrater, Francisco Mangado, Álvaro Siza o Eduardo Souto de Moura, entre otros. El libro está íntegramente compuesto por desplegables y divido en 25 apartados en los que se detalla cada obra a través de fotografías de Juan Rodríguez, detalles técnicos, textos de los arquitectos y una selección de dibujos destacados en Pantone fluorescente que muestra la concepción del arquitecto yuxtapuesta a la construcción final. La encuadernación en tapa dura se completa con una sobrecubierta a modo de faja en el color Pantone fluorescente en el que destaca un troquel que recuerda la trama de malla metálica más reconocida de la compañía Jofebar. Cliente: Labirinto de Paixóns, Jofebar. Proyecto realizado en ©tresctres bajo la marca de Diseño Editorial trespuntos. Dirección de proyecto: Juan Rodríguez. Fotografías de proyecto: Anabel Carrión.

item.title: Fujigoo
item.description: After staying some time in Japan and soaking up its culture, I've created this character - inspired by Mount Fuji and Tengu, a Japanese mythological creature. Presented in a toy-matryoshka form, it is expected to be produced some day...
item.content:encoded: After staying some time in Japan and soaking up its culture, I've created this character - inspired by Mount Fuji and Tengu, a Japanese mythological creature. Presented in a toy-matryoshka form, it is expected to be produced some day...

item.title: Olympikus Mobile Apps + Website
item.description: Working along with DON Agency on the expansion of the digital image for Olympus Argentina. We developed an interactive website with product samples, technical specifications and other information related to equipment and sports sponsored by Olympus Argentina in companionship of a QR campaign to encourage sales and user interaction with the brands within sale points.
item.content:encoded: Working along with DON Agency on the expansion of the digital image for Olympus Argentina. We developed an interactive website with product samples, technical specifications and other information related to equipment and sports sponsored by Olympus Argentina in companionship of a QR campaign to encourage sales and user interaction with the brands within sale points.

item.title: 13thCollective - Jordan - Concept Project
item.description: This project was inspired by the Jordan Retro Card, and my personal favorite Jordan sneaker the Jordan 4 "Fire Man". I find it interesting that the Jordan Brand does not name their Jordan sneaker releases, but rather just ascribes a sequential number to them. I wanted to create an illustrated type based off of the number of the sneaker release, combined with the actual sneaker itself. As a sneaker head, this was a very exciting and fun project to work on.
item.content:encoded: This project was inspired by the Jordan Retro Card, and my personal favorite Jordan sneaker the Jordan 4 "Fire Man". I find it interesting that the Jordan Brand does not name their Jordan sneaker releases, but rather just ascribes a sequential number to them. I wanted to create an illustrated type based off of the number of the sneaker release, combined with the actual sneaker itself. As a sneaker head, this was a very exciting and fun project to work on.

item.title: Magazine
item.description: Guim Tió is a young artist from Barcelona. His research interest in pictorial part of the human condition, treated with humor, irony and a strong degree of provocation, and reflects on a society full of taboos and subjected to a very visual tyranny of television, advertising and, of course, of fashion magazines. With the model representations and contemporary references in behavior and appearance, beauty and glamor, extracted from the coated paper for magazines, Guim makes a pictorial opera(c)tion through brilliantly combined with the photographic medium - to "eye surgery": a metaphor for the physical manipulation of plastic surgery, genetics and cybernetics, revealing that dark part of the human soul hided behind the pretense of perfection. The artist stages a controversial issue for contemporary society and his work becomes an exploration of the collective unconscious, which governs the aesthetic valences on all types of human monstrosities in the sign of narcissistic beauty emulation as the key to success; a parody of stereotypes that today govern the new conceptions of the meaning "human being". Original text from Massimo Cova.
item.content:encoded: Guim Tió is a young artist from Barcelona. His research interest in pictorial part of the human condition, treated with humor, irony and a strong degree of provocation, and reflects on a society full of taboos and subjected to a very visual tyranny of television, advertising and, of course, of fashion magazines. With the model representations and contemporary references in behavior and appearance, beauty and glamor, extracted from the coated paper for magazines, Guim makes a pictorial opera(c)tion through brilliantly combined with the photographic medium - to "eye surgery": a metaphor for the physical manipulation of plastic surgery, genetics and cybernetics, revealing that dark part of the human soul hided behind the pretense of perfection. The artist stages a controversial issue for contemporary society and his work becomes an exploration of the collective unconscious, which governs the aesthetic valences on all types of human monstrosities in the sign of narcissistic beauty emulation as the key to success; a parody of stereotypes that today govern the new conceptions of the meaning "human being". Original text from Massimo Cova.

item.title: United Bamboo 2013 Cat Calendar
item.description: 2013 calendar featuring 12 cats dressed in exact miniatures of United Bamboo and Bamboo By Collections. Each month features a special layout with weekends in silver foil and weekdays in clear foil. Printed on triple thick paper inspired by children's books. Photography by Noah Sheldon.
item.content:encoded: 2013 calendar featuring 12 cats dressed in exact miniatures of United Bamboo and Bamboo By Collections. Each month features a special layout with weekends in silver foil and weekdays in clear foil. Printed on triple thick paper inspired by children's books. Photography by Noah Sheldon.

item.title: Maple Set
item.description: With this project we wanted to explore an alternative emotion to the standard kitchen knives you see every day. The focus is drawn to the high polished blade, while the rest of the knife's Maple wood body sits warmly in the hand and blends in to its surroundings. The wood is sealed and food safe to allow for easy cleanup. The knife gives the appearance of being lightweight; however their weight is balanced to ensure that they can be used by any level of chef.
item.content:encoded: With this project we wanted to explore an alternative emotion to the standard kitchen knives you see every day. The focus is drawn to the high polished blade, while the rest of the knife's Maple wood body sits warmly in the hand and blends in to its surroundings. The wood is sealed and food safe to allow for easy cleanup. The knife gives the appearance of being lightweight; however their weight is balanced to ensure that they can be used by any level of chef.

item.title: Daisy London
item.description: Part of an ongoing project with London based jewellery company, Daisy. After completing a rebrand, we have taken on their global campaign consisting of instore material, corporate stationery, packaging, website graphics, mailers, printed promotional material amongst others deliverables. This project will continue to be updated as we continue our journey with Daisy.
item.content:encoded: Part of an ongoing project with London based jewellery company, Daisy. After completing a rebrand, we have taken on their global campaign consisting of instore material, corporate stationery, packaging, website graphics, mailers, printed promotional material amongst others deliverables. This project will continue to be updated as we continue our journey with Daisy.
